definition: echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises

sentences.english: That bangthat was his house, Kirk o'Field.
sentences.chinese: 那声巨响就来自他的房子，柯克欧菲尔德。

sentences.english: The loud noise scared me stiff.
As Saeed went to fetch food a huge explosion rocked the market.
sentences.chinese: 当赛义德去买食物的时候一声巨响在市场炸开了。

sentences.english: Behind them, the great iron doors closed with a resounding clang.
sentences.chinese: 在他们身后，巨型铁门阖上，“锵”的一声巨响。

sentences.english: With the booming sound which shakes the earth.
sentences.chinese: 随着地动山摇的一声巨响。

sentences.english: Hear ye attentively the terror of his voice, and the sound that cometh out of his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 你们且细听天主的怒吼声，听那从他口中发出的巨响。

sentences.english: You make loud bangs at the surface and listen to the returning echoes.
sentences.chinese: 您砰砰巨响在表面上，并听取返回的回声。

sentences.english: Today, I was driving my child to school when the car let out a huge bang. It shuddered to a halt.
sentences.chinese: 今天我开车送儿子上学，车突然发出一声巨响抛锚了。

sentences.english: Then the lights went out. I heard a crash.
sentences.chinese: 然后灯就灭了，就听见一声巨响。

sentences.english: The tracking points can then be re-set by a clapping your hands or making any loud noise.
sentences.chinese: 跟踪点，然后再由鼓掌你的手或作出任何巨响。

sentences.english: The tree cracked loudly and fell.
sentences.chinese: 那棵树发出咔的一声巨响断裂倒下了。

sentences.english: I heard a big noise like thunder.
sentences.chinese: 我听到了像雷一样地一声巨响。

sentences.english: About an hour later, he heard six deafening blasts coming from the mountainside.
sentences.chinese: 大约一个小时后，他听到从山腰处传来六声巨响。

sentences.english: I woke up when I heard a loud noise.
sentences.chinese: 我听到一声巨响时就醒了过来。

sentences.english: Then with a shocking bang, half of the ice mountain was blasted away.
sentences.chinese: 然后，随着一声惊天动地的巨响，半座冰山被炸飞了。

definition: loud sound, such as that of thunder or a bomb/to rumble/to roar
loudly/with a loud bang/a loud rumble
